===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|さい}}
From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=さい}} {{m|zh|災|tr=tsoj||calamity}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=goon|さい}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|さい}}

# an [[act of God]], a [[disaster]], a [[calamity]]

=====Usage notes=====
Seldom used on its own. Most often used in compounds.

=====Derived terms=====
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-r|災害|さいがい}}: [[disaster]], [[calamity]] {{qualifier|emphasis on the damage therefrom}}
* {{ja-r|災難|さいなん}}: [[misfortune]], [[disaster]], [[catastrophe]]
{{der-bottom}}

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|わざわい}}
{{IPAchar|/wazapapi/}} → {{IPAchar|/wazaɸaɸi/}} → {{IPAchar|/wazawahi/}} → {{IPAchar|/wazawai/}}

From {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=わざわい}}. Originally a compound of {{m|ja|業|tr=waza||deed, doings}}, in reference to the doings of the {{m|ja|神|tr=kami||gods, spirits}} + {{m|ja|這う|這い|tr=hai|lit=crawling|spreading widely}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref> Compare the etymology of [[幸#sakiwai|幸]] (''sakiwai'', “good fortune”). Compare also the connotations of the English term {{m|en|act of God}} in reference to [[disaster]]s.

Often spelled {{m|ja|災い}} with the trailing [[okurigana]] {{m|ja|い}} to make the reading more explicit.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|わざわい|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Alternative forms====
* {{ja-l|災い}}, {{ja-l|禍}}, {{ja-l|殃}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|わざわい|hhira=わざはひ}}

# an [[act of God]], a [[disaster]], a [[calamity]]

=====Idioms=====
{{der-top|Idioms}}
* {{ja-r|災を転じて福と為す|わざわい を てんじて ふく と なす}}: “to turn a calamity into good fortune”
{{der-bottom}}
